column1: Dating in the U.S. (Questions and answers should be designed for Japanese ESL students who are completely unfamiliar with American culture.)

column2: In the U.S., what does it usually mean when two people are 'dating' but not 'exclusive'?
column3: They are married to other people.
column4: They are only friends and never hold hands.
column5: They might go on dates with other people too.
column6: They must see each other every single day.

column2: 「昨夜、彼とデートしました」を英語にする時、最も自然なものはどれですか？
column3: I went on a date with him last night.
column4: I made a date with him last night.
column5: I had a play with him last night.
column6: I worked with him last night.

column2: True or False: In the U.S., it is common to hug your date when you meet them for the first time.
If a man asks a woman to dinner in the U.S., who usually pays the bill in a traditional setting?
column4: The person who asked for the date usually pays.
column6: They always ask the waiter to pay.

column2: What is a 'blind date' in American culture?
column3: A date with someone who cannot see.
column4: A date where you go to a very dark movie theater.
column5: A date with a person you have never seen or met before.
column6: A date that happens late at night.

column2: アメリカで「交際を申し込む（付き合ってくださいと言う）」際、最も一般的な表現はどれですか？
column4: Will you go out with me?
column5: I want to marry you today.

column2: Choose the best Japanese translation for: 'We are just seeing each other.'
column3: 私たちは結婚する予定です。
column4: 私たちはただ見つめ合っています。
column5: 私たちは（まだ正式ではないが）数回デートをしている仲です。
column6: 私たちは全く会っていません。

column2: Which topic is considered 'bad manners' on a first date in the U.S.?
column4: Talking about your job or school.
column5: Asking exactly how much money the other person earns.

column2: True or False: If an American says 'I'll call you' at the end of a date, they always call within 10 minutes.
Your date says, 'I'll pick you up at 7:00.' What does this mean?
column3: They will come to your house in their car to get you.
column4: They will call your phone at 7:00.
column5: They want you to walk to their house at 7:00.
column6: They want you to carry them at 7:00.
